summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and attorney Gloria Allred's office, coordinating travel arrangements for two witnesses (clients of Allred) to New York for interviews related to the grand jury investigation and trial preparation in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails detail flight, hotel, and car service logistics, and clarify that the meetings are for official grand jury and trial purposes, not informal interviews.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney whose firm is coordinating travel for two clients (witnesses) to meet with federal prosecutors in the Epstein case. Her executive assistant, Diane Aldrich, handles the logistics.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Handles all travel coordination and communication with the U.S. Attorney's Office for two witnesses traveling to New York for interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: SDNY prosecutor involved in the Epstein case, initiating the witness travel coordination and clarifying that the meetings are part of grand jury investigation and trial preparation.

persons.name: Victim Witness Coordinator
persons.context: Government employee responsible for arranging and funding official travel, hotels, and per diem for witnesses traveling to meet with prosecutors in the Epstein case.

connections.description: Allred is the attorney and Aldrich is her executive assistant, with Aldrich handling all logistical communication for Allred's clients.
Allred's office coordinates with the government's Victim Witness Coordinator to arrange and fund official travel for Allred's clients who are witnesses.
Both work for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY; the AUSA initiates the witness coordination and the Victim Witness Coordinator handles the logistics.
The AUSA contacts Allred to arrange for her clients (witnesses) to travel to New York for meetings related to the Epstein grand jury and trial.

events.title: Witness Interviews in New York
events.description: Planned interviews of two witnesses (clients of Gloria Allred) by SDNY prosecutors at the Lotte New York Palace hotel, as part of the Epstein grand jury investigation and trial preparation.

events.title: Witness Travel to New York
events.description: Detailed travel arrangements for two witnesses to fly from Las Vegas/Arizona to New York City, stay at hotels (50 Bowery, Lotte NY Palace), and have car service arranged for airport transfers and interview transportation.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Lotte New York Palace, 455 Madison Avenue at 50th, New York, NY
keyFacts: The SDNY was actively preparing for trial in the Epstein case in July 2019, coordinating travel for witnesses to give testimony.
Attorney Gloria Allred represented at least two witnesses (her 'clients') who were traveling to New York to meet with federal prosecutors.
The U.S. Attorney's Office strictly distinguished between informal 'interviews' and formal meetings for grand jury/trial testimony, with travel funding only authorized for the latter.
Witness travel was funded by the government, including flights, hotels, car service, and a per diem ($76 for two days) plus a witness fee ($40 per day).
Email correspondence shows careful logistical planning and sensitivity to witness comfort, indicating the witnesses were likely victims or key witnesses in the case.
